system_prompt:
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about documentation.  

Use the search tool to find relevant information from the course materials before answering questions.  

If you can find specific information through search, use it to provide accurate answers.

Always include references by citing the filename of the source material you used.
Replace it with the full path to the GitHub repository:
"https://github.com/DataTalksClub/faq/blob/main/"
Format: [LINK TITLE](FULL_GITHUB_LINK)


If the search doesn't return relevant results, let the user know and provide general guidance.

parts.content: Can I adapt the course content for AWS instead of the original platform?

messages.instructions:
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about documentation.  

Use the search tool to find relevant information from the course materials before answering questions.  

If you can find specific information through search, use it to provide accurate answers.

Always include references by citing the filename of the source material you used.
Replace it with the full path to the GitHub repository:
"https://github.com/DataTalksClub/faq/blob/main/"
Format: [LINK TITLE](FULL_GITHUB_LINK)


If the search doesn't return relevant results, let the user know and provide general guidance.

content.question: Environment: I want to use AWS. May I do that?
content.content:
Yes, you can. Just remember to adapt all the information from the videos to AWS. Additionally, the final capstone will be evaluated based on these tasks:

- Create a data pipeline
- Develop a visualization

Consider that when seeking help, you might need to rely on fellow coursemates who use AWS, which could be fewer compared to those using GCP.

Also, see ["Is it possible to use x tool instead of the one tool you use?"](#4dec1f8407)

content.question: Course: When does the course start?
content.content:
The next cohort starts January 13th, 2025. More info at [DTC](https://datatalks.club/blog/guide-to-free-online-courses-at-datatalks-club.html).

- Register before the course starts using this [link](https://airtable.com/shr6oVXeQvSI5HuWD).
- Join the [course Telegram channel with announcements](https://t.me/dezoomcamp).
- Don’t forget to register in DataTalks.Club's Slack and join the channel.

content.question: Course: What are the prerequisites for this course?
content.content:
To get the most out of this course, you should have:

- Basic coding experience
- Familiarity with SQL
- Experience with Python (helpful but not required)

No prior data engineering experience is necessary. See [Readme on GitHub](https://github.com/DataTalksClub/data-engineering-zoomcamp/blob/main/README.md#prerequisites).

content.question: Course - Can I follow the course after it finishes?
content.content:
Yes, we will keep all the materials available, so you can follow the course at your own pace after it finishes.

You can also continue reviewing the homeworks and prepare for the next cohort. You can also start working on your final capstone project.

content.question: Course: What can I do before the course starts?
content.content:
Start by installing and setting up all the dependencies and requirements:

- Google Cloud account
- Google Cloud SDK
- Python 3 (installed with Anaconda)
- Terraform
- Git

Look over the prerequisites and syllabus to see if you are comfortable with these subjects.

parts.content:
Yes, you can adapt the course content for AWS instead of the original platform. Just remember to adjust all the information from the videos to fit AWS. Additionally, for the final capstone project, you will still need to create a data pipeline and develop a visualization.

Keep in mind that while seeking help, your peers who are using AWS may be fewer compared to those using Google Cloud Platform (GCP). 

For more details, refer to the specific FAQ entry on this topic: [View Here](https://github.com/DataTalksClub/faq/blob/main/faq-main/_questions/data-engineering-zoomcamp/general/031_21c45a3556_environment-i-want-to-use-aws-may-i-do-that.md).
